results.title: The Islands: Watery Outposts of Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fauna”.
A visually stimulating look at a wide variety of Australian island habitats and wildlife, both above and below the tide line. Aerial, surface and underwater photography explores the world of the birds, reptiles, mammals and fish that inhabit the islands and coral reefs. Prominently featured is one of Australia’s natural wonders - the Great Barrier Reef.

results.title: The Remarkable bandicoots
results.creator_credit: David Moore, Peter Du Cane, Film Centre (Perth, W.A.) and Wildfilm Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fauna”.
Until 1930 the Rabbit-Eared Bandicoot, or Bilby, was relatively common in various parts of Australia but suddenly it disappeared from many of them. Today it is the subject of an intensive search and study sponsored by the World Wildlife Fund. The program investigates the history and mystery of this beautiful marsupial. Narrated by David Moore.

results.title: I am how I look
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Feelings”.
Explores how children view their physical selves and how that relates to the whole self-image. Includes children describing how they look, the importance of differences for helping one develop a sense of self-identity and specific suggestions for liking oneself better. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

group_siblings.title: I am what I know
group_siblings.creator_credit: Glenda Fillinger, Paul Fillinger and Churchill Films

results.title: I'm feeling happy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Feelings”.
Children sing about and experience a number of things that bring happiness: The pleasures of smelling and eating good things, a bubbly bath, waking up on a sunny morning; the accomplishment of learning to drive, the inner satisfaction of being helpful without thought of reward and the warmth of sharing a friendship.

group_siblings.creator_credit: Glenda Fillinger, Paul Fillinger and Churchill Films

results.title: I am how I feel
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Feelings”.
One of a series of three films dealing with the question “Who am I?”. Presents a series of sketches about the expression of feelings. Ways of handling negative feelings and achieving more positive feelings are shown. All people have the same basic emotions but respond differently in particular situations. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: I am what I know
results.creator_credit: Glenda Fillinger, Paul Fillinger and Churchill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Feelings”.
Encourages a positive attitude towards what we do know and towards attaining new knowledge. Children’s comments and songs are used to explain that different people know different things. Illustrates ways to feel better about one’s attainments. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Australia
results.creator_credit: Stafford Garner, Stewart MacLennan and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Families of the world”.
Join 11 year-old Catherine Inall and learn about her life in Sydney and her Christmas summer vacation on a sheep farm in remote northern New South Wales. Catherine participates in a way of life that is both new to her and unique to Australia. Designed for students from the Northern hemisphere, it is interesting to look at Australian life from a foreigner’s perspective. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teacher’s guide included.
